title: Chapter 2564: The Goddess Scattered Flowers To Block The Ghost Tide (3)
body:
Chapter 2564: The Goddess Scattered Flowers To Block The Ghost Tide (3)

Chapter 2564: The Goddess Scattered Flowers to Block the Ghost Tide (3)

Editor: Nyoi-Bo Studio

“Woo!”

The ghosts howled and broke out in all directions.

However, because of the shackles that restricted them, the space became constricted.

The forces from all directions restricted each of them and made it difficult for the brainless ghosts to move.

In just an instant, the surging tide of ghosts stopped!

The entire Changde Town fell into a temporary silence!

Amidst the ghostly cries, the evil ghosts could not move, but the ones outside the town still advanced and caused the blockage to build up. It was as if what they tried to build was about to be cast into an impenetrable ghost wall between Heaven and Earth.

“This Divine Secret…”

Aunt Xiang looked back and was surprised.

She couldn’t see the evil spirits, but she could see the spirit threads and the wriggling nodes of the large net that covered the entire town.

Without a doubt, this represented the countless ghosts!

Xi’s Spirits Controlling technique to summon the ghost tide was blocked by Xu Xiaoshou’s Divine Secret technique!

The key point here was that Xu Xiaoshou used such a broken Divine Puppet. This guy’s improvement was too fast!

“Sizzle!”

The White Sin Karmic Fire began to burn.

It followed the great net of Heaven and Earth, as if it wanted to burn everything, and delay the move toward its own side.

It was as if the world was about to be ignited by countless white fuses. The scene was extremely spectacular.

Aunt Xiang did not dare to delay any longer.

She knew that this Divine Secret could only defend against the ghost tide for a while, but not forever.

The power of the heavenly flame was very strong!

And in this current situation, Xi was considered small but Dao Qiongcang was big!

Whether or not they could break out of this chaotic situation did not depend on the Divine Puppet that could clench its buttocks with a single move, but rather on Kui Leihan!

“Cao Yihan!” Aunt Xiang looked in the direction of the street. “What’s the meaning of this? Don’t you recognize me?”

“Rumble…”

With a roar, thunder rumbled in the Nine Heavens.

The evil spirits that had been stuck in the sky in Changde Town still struggled violently in the woven net. Suddenly, they trembled.

The world seemed to have stopped for a few breaths. Only a deep voice sounded across the street.

“The temple is too small to accommodate the Gods and Buddhas.”

Jin Ren was stunned.

Kui Leihan’s attitude was very ambiguous.

This was a little different from what Bazhun’an had mentioned… No, it seemed that Bazhun’an did not state that once he arrived, Kui Leihan would definitely help?

What he said was it was just a gift from a peerless genius, and he had to personally go and take it away?

Aunt Xiang was furious.

She seemed to have a good relationship with Kui Leihan and she felt a little embarrassed that she had not received any help.

“It’s not like I haven’t been to your lousy blacksmith shop before. No matter how small it is, it can’t fit four people?”

“Woo!” The evil spirits were about to make a move when another bolt of lightning exploded in the dark sky.

All of a sudden, all the ghosts fell silent. The world waited.

Kui Leihan’s voice sounded again and it was as if he had just woken up. His tone was unfriendly.

“You said it yourself, it’s a lousy blacksmith shop, just a lousy blacksmith shop…”

“There is already a large hole in my shop today. If there were more people, won’t the entire roof be blown off by you all?”

Aunt Xiang was about to speak when a glimmer of suspicion flashed in her eyes.

Jin Ren caught the strange point at the same time. They looked over and saw that there was indeed a hole in the ceiling of Cao’s Blacksmith Shop.

This hole was too carefully designed!

Since it wasn’t intentional…

In the vast world, who within the five regions would run to the dwelling place of the Ten High Nobles Kui Leihan and open such a huge hole?

What did Kui Leihan really want to say?

What did he want to warn them about?

Just as he thought about this, a strange sound came from the piece of bloody cloth beside Zhu Yike, who was unconscious but still twitching.

Jin Ren turned around.

Bloody cloth?

Zhu Yike didn’t take this thing away and still brought it with him?

No, it was that damned Kui Leihan who had caught them off guard!

“Sizzle…”

A hand reached out and tore the bloody cloth.

Dao Qiongcang supported his body and crawled out of the compressed cloth space with a faint smile on his face.

“You were so hesitant and tried to beat around the bush… This made me look down on you, Old Cao.”

“Let’s get straight to the point!”

Dao Qiongcang spread his hands and looked at the Divine Puppet. He said with a mocking expression.

“I made that hole.”

“I arrived early and waited for a long time. When I did not see anyone, I went back to look for you… Xu Xiaoshou, are you surprised?”
